20110125161113.000|20110125161116.000|TR0|before President Obama was in office.

20110125161118.000|20110125161121.000|TR0|It is part of the "Pledge to America," and 
20110125161121.000|20110125161123.000|TR0|Republicans now say that that will 
20110125161123.000|20110125161126.000|TR0|probably add up to $60 billion, less than

20110125161131.000|20110125161133.000|TR0|year.  So that is something that

20110125162112.000|20110125162115.000|TR0|ALISON KOSIK, CNN BUSINESS CORRESPONDENT:  
20110125162115.000|20110125162117.000|TR0|Well, right now, Carol, McDonald's is not 
20110125162117.000|20110125162120.000|TR0|saying when it's going to raise prices on 
20110125162120.000|20110125162122.000|TR0|its menu items, or by how much.  Just know 
20110125162122.000|20110125162125.000|TR0|we will see price increases on the menu 
20110125162125.000|20110125162127.000|TR0|this year.
20110125162127.000|20110125162130.000|TR0|
20110125162130.000|20110125162132.000|TR0|Now, keep in mind that this isn't going to 
20110125162132.000|20110125162135.000|TR0|be an across-the-menu hike in prices.  
20110125162135.000|20110125162137.000|TR0|McDonald's is going to go in there and 
20110125162137.000|20110125162140.000|TR0|raise prices on only select items.
20110125162140.000|20110125162142.000|TR0|
20110125162142.000|20110125162145.000|TR0|And, you know, it's kind of a balancing 
20110125162145.000|20110125162147.000|TR0|act for McDonald's, because if you think 
20110125162147.000|20110125162150.000|TR0|about it, people go there to get a 
20110125162150.000|20110125162152.000|TR0|low-price meal.  And I guess rule number 
20110125162152.000|20110125162155.000|TR0|one in the fast-food biz is you don't want 
20110125162155.000|20110125162157.000|TR0|to scare away the consumer with high 
20110125162157.000|20110125162200.000|TR0|prices at your restaurant -- Carol.
20110125162200.000|20110125162202.000|TR0|
20110125162202.000|20110125162205.000|TR0|COSTELLO:  Well, I know.  But what's 
20110125162205.000|20110125162207.000|TR0|behind the increase, then? It's not like 
20110125162207.000|20110125162210.000|TR0|the economy is getting increasingly, 
20110125162210.000|20110125162212.000|TR0|markedly better?
20110125162212.000|20110125162215.000|TR0|
20110125162215.000|20110125162217.000|TR0|KOSIK:  It is getting better, but 
20110125162217.000|20110125162220.000|TR0|McDonald's is blaming rising commodity 
20110125162220.000|20110125162222.000|TR0|costs like grain and meat.  But, Carol, 
20110125162222.000|20110125162225.000|TR0|keep in mind, this isn't just McDonald's.  
20110125162225.000|20110125162227.000|TR0|This is restaurants as a whole.
20110125162227.000|20110125162230.000|TR0|
20110125162230.000|20110125162232.000|TR0|I mean, these higher commodity prices are 
20110125162232.000|20110125162235.000|TR0|affecting restaurants all over the place.  
20110125162235.000|20110125162237.000|TR0|So don't be surprised when you sit down at 
20110125162237.000|20110125162240.000|TR0|a local restaurant where you may go to and

20110125164455.000|20110125164458.000|TR0|COSTELLO:  Interesting.  You know, 
20110125164458.000|20110125164500.000|TR0|protesters in Tunisia were able to 
20110125164500.000|20110125164503.000|TR0|overthrow the government there.  How 
20110125164503.000|20110125164505.000|TR0|serious do you think this is?
20110125164505.000|20110125164508.000|TR0|
20110125164508.000|20110125164510.000|TR0|WEDEMAN:  Well that's really hard to say, 
20110125164510.000|20110125164513.000|TR0|because this was something -- it's been 
20110125164513.000|20110125164515.000|TR0|planned now for about a week and a half in 
20110125164515.000|20110125164518.000|TR0|response to events in Tunisia.  The 
20110125164518.000|20110125164520.000|TR0|Tunisian situation really got out of 
20110125164520.000|20110125164523.000|TR0|control when police started to open fire 
20110125164523.000|20110125164525.000|TR0|and kill demonstrators. As far as I know, 
20110125164525.000|20110125164528.000|TR0|that has not happened here.
